title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create a movie rating advisor:
1. Create a variable 'age' with a number
2. If age is under 13: display 'You can watch G and PG movies'
3. Else if age is under 17: display 'You can watch G, PG, and PG-13 movies'
4. Else: display 'You can watch all movies including R-rated'
instructions:
Create a movie rating advisor:
1. Create a variable 'age' with a number
2. If age is under 13: display 'You can watch G and PG movies'
3. Else if age is under 17: display 'You can watch G, PG, and PG-13 movies'
4. Else: display 'You can watch all movies including R-rated'

testCases.expectedOutput: You can watch G, PG, and PG-13 movies

hints.text: Use if (age < 13), then else if (age < 17), then else for the rest.

commonMistakes.consequence: if (age >= 0) catches everyone before if (age >= 18) can run.
commonMistakes.correction: Check from most specific to least specific: if (age >= 18) before if (age >= 0).

commonMistakes.mistake: Using separate if statements instead of else if
commonMistakes.consequence: Multiple if statements can all run, causing duplicate output.
commonMistakes.correction: Use else if to ensure only one block executes.
Use else if (condition) or just else without a condition.
